lead_paragraph: Much of the nervousness in the capital, Brasília, stems from a sweeping corruption investigation that, despite a change in administrations, has not gone away.

byline.contributor: Paula Moura and Claire Rigby contributed reporting from São Paulo.

headline.print_headline: Who’s Taping Whom? As Graft Roils Brazil, Paranoia Reigns
headline.main: Who’s Taping Whom? Paranoia Infuses Brazil’s Scandal-Ridden Politics

snippet: Much of the nervousness in the capital, Brasília, stems from a sweeping corruption investigation that, despite a change in administrations, has not gone away....
abstract: Sweeping corruption investigation in Brazil has left entire political class paranoid, prompting politicians to record all conversations they have, even with colleagues; newly installed Pres Michel Temer already faces calls for impeachment, following release of secret recording of conversation he had with one of his ministers in which property deal was discussed.
